BZNRCdgo1JMzMEDA2wJ6zg.text: A very cozy and heartwarming restaurant with a friendly staff. Most importantly, the food was out of this world, because it felt as if it was homemade traditional Lebanese food. I would highly recommend it if you want to try some original Lebanese food that is extremely exquisite. Go for it!

xXHUVMl8a_4I11usaR_95Q.text: Excellent food and everything was on point apart from the Ayran but that is a minor compared to the rest.

XORIlUPT5DORZwowHX24-Q.text: Excellent hummus, tabbouleh and soup.  Chicken a bit on the overdone side, but not too bad.  Great bread.Also, I like that it's 'everyday classy'  - meaning it's not stuffy, not too expensive, but nice enough to where it makes, say, a Monday evening a bit special and out of the ordinary.

U0RazynMpFN34sXo-rn1NQ.text: We were in London recently for 5 days and found this gem. We liked it so much that we ate dinner there 2 of the 5 days. The food is delicious, authentic, and fresh at a reasonable price. The atmosphere is comfortable and it's only a block from the Earls Court Underground Station.

OMjNY1DYTL6ps2xd4S98ug.text: Great shawarma. Great za'tar pastry. They also had a more upscale dine in menu which looked pretty good. Prices range from $ for quick bites to $$$ for more complex Lebanese dine in dishes. Highly recommend.

3983RTTHPDUu5FNStbT2ew.text: Amazing food and service! Some of the best hummus and tabbouleh I've had, and I've had quite a lot. The place is small but if you have to wait, it's well worth it to try their special Hummus Beiruty, Halloumi, and meats.

wXPxN1QLZtU9OaN_1sdshw.text: This was a superb restaurant, a round the corner and out of the way from the Earls Court underground. Its very easy to take a quick peek through the door and to keep on walking--it is very unpretentious. But don't! The service was great. The food was excellent. The portions are large (they could easily feed two). We had a great family dinner.

O2VQ755S9Z_wunLPMAU5ww.text: UPLIFTINGLast evening, I found myself at my last evening of a week-long vacation from those personal and professional responsibilities lurking back in California. The prospect of the next day's eleven-hour flight home to the daily treadmill was almost enough to make me weep; the experience promised to be akin to traveling to ones own execution. But, for the moment, I was still in my favorite city in the whole world - London - and I was out for a last meal, so to speak.Close by the hotel and off Earl's Court Road, I came upon the Orjowan restaurant subtitled as "Fine Lebanese Cuisine." The establishment's name, as well as the names of the dishes on the menu, suggested more than just a little Turkish influence. But who was I to quibble over the food's provenance? I was simply looking for an uplift from imminent depression through food.My dinner selection was called "Kafta Yoghurtliyeh", and revealed itself to be thumb-sized chunks of minced-then-grilled lamb in a thick yogurt sauce with pine nuts over which were sprinkled thumbnail-sized chips of toasted pita bread. This dish, spooned over rice and accompanied by a salad of lettuce and sliced tomatoes, cucumbers, radishes and bell peppers tossed in a vinegar and oil dressing, and all washed down with a Lebanese beer, was a delicious and immensely satisfying end to a cherished week spent selfishly only on myself. And the meal cost about $30.The staff was attentive and dedicated, though they were hardly being taxed as, the hour being early for dinner for most (5:30 PM), I was the only customer. I trust the place would fill-up later as the ambience, menu and presentation were too attractive to permit otherwise.Perhaps I'm being hasty to award 5 stars after only one visit, but the meal was faultless and I'm unlikely to get back to visit the place again to try other dishes.I'm currently pecking this out at 34,000 feet over the mid-Atlantic. There are about 8.5 hours of the flight to go. Just shoot me now.

Zlp0CR01Y8ip9_vMWYzRBg.text: Best Lebanese food i've had outside Beirut..amazing!

Y27LavSs_UJv3A-HT7rJxA.text: Going on the previous solitary 5 star review we gave a stab at Orjowan. Honestly we were heading back to Mai Food,across the road, but it was early and they don't open till 6.30. Hunger drove us across the road to this 'unassuming' rather quiet Lebanese restaurant. Greeted and seated we decided on boned chicken and lamb, both char grilled and served with rice and salad. Sides of homous, olives and a yoghurt and cucumber salad. And fresh carrot juice. Chicken was delicious, perfectly cooked. Lamb was nice, slightly over cooked. Humous was very authentic with lots of tahini. The olives were plenty but not great. The atmosphere was quiet bordering on a vibe of business is not what is should be. The bill included service. Not something I like. Tipping is a optional comment for the punter. If you add it to the bill then it's just the price and it should be in the price of food on the menu. All this said things where just OK until I visited the toilets.The toilets were really poor. It a restaurant with a good degree of effort put into its decor the toilets looked third rate. And you cannot get away with dirty, tatty toilets in a restaurant. Not good!

photos.caption: Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom

sqmzoA3beAMPzsHGazas9Q.text: We went here yesterday for lunch based on the above comments. I agree totally with the above comments. The place was lovely. It was completely empty but the food was fantactic. The lady (I assume the owner) was really nice but also left us alone which was good. Three of us had the mixed grill and one of us has some chicken. I have to say it was brilliant. Next time we are in the area we will come here to eat!

n58HYg2A1e3kHDABHNDGpg.text: Mixed reviews about this place. Food was exceptional but the service is something to be desired. Between the appetizers and main meal we were asked to move tables to accommodate a party of 14. While we graciously accommodated, we did expect a little something in return. Only after complaining at the end of the meal about a mandatory service charge that the waitress indicated did not go to her, the service charge was removed and we were offered a few token baklava just before we stepped out. Drinks took long to arrive and had to repeatedly ask for water. The reason this restaurant gets three stars is because the food is exceptional.

EuOChd39nzmtxERkTPeZvg.text: Tucked away on a quiet little street in Kensington, this gem of a restaurant is easy to pass by. Luckily we had inside info about this one, and were taken there by a pilot who makes it a point to stop here whenever he stops over in London. Very quiet and unassuming, so don't go here if you want hustle and bustle. However, you quickly forget about others (and everything else for that matter), once you start eating. WOW! Fast service, fresh tasting, I love lebanese and this stuff is good!!! I highly highly recommend the Farrouj Meshwi (half a boneless marinated chicken, charcoal grilled)...beautifully seasoned, so tender, incredible. Accompanied with great basmati rice. My friends had the lamb which they also raved about. Hummous is so fresh, dolma is amazing...some great baklava to finish off the meal. Highly highly recommended, can't wait to go back.

VbXysUFrJyDQ1WljMGWC9A.text: I didn't go to the restaurant, only the bakery next door. Sheer nostalgia - intense cravings for manaeesh (Levantine pizzas). I loved the look of the place - pure Beirut bakery, with small shopfront, view to oven, and a few tables. Menu was as expected - zaatar (thyme), cheese, lahme bajaeen (meat). Prices were not Beirut, of course, but cheap for London. I was disappointed that they were not open for breakfast (manousheh should be eaten in the morning), but when in London....  Truth be told, the product was average, but I'm comparing it with Beirut or Amman, so not really fair. Looks like they were serving authentic Turkish coffee, which I didn't manage to try.

X5kT3gIMAyep618G-qvDqw.text: There have been many restaurants that have occupied this part of Earls Court, none have stayed that long, but with the quality food that Orjowan serves, they will be here to stay. A great alternative to the many chinese and fast food joints that grace the area of Earls court. Healthy and full of flavoursome delights in their delectable menu! Either order and take out or dine in, you will not be disappointed with your choice!

ZsglYHSvgoPTQlmLP_QzVg.text: I love this restaurant, the atmosphere is really cosy and warm, the food is excellent and very well priced. Everyone who works there is really friendly and are very happy to give their recommendations on what to eat.

Xpli0pD0SPO1VKD93t0H8w.text: beats every restaurant on edgware road, we'll worth going there again.

j1I_LZ1h8isd7ucop3fVOw.text: We have decided to visit this restaurant after reading a lot of encouraging reviews about it along in being a short walk distance from where we live. Gladly the place didn't disappoint us ; the staff were very welcoming & friendly. They had taken our orders quickly and promptly. the place was quite small with only very few people & it didn't have any wi fi.We ordered one Taboula *which is the traditional Lebanese Salad* it came out very tasty. Then we ordered mixed grills * consisting from small pieces of mixed lamb and chicken and bread on the side* along with chicken Shaorma *which is also a very famous tasty shredded grilled chicken dish* that also came out with bread along with some garlic sauce and mayo. Luckily none of these dishes came out too oily or too dry , their meet & chicken texture was just right. For the drinks their menu was very limited & a bit disappointing, it only had fresh juices along with softdrinks but with no cocktails that would have been a great add to their tasty food. Their prices were very reasonable & it would be a good experience especially for those who are not very familiar with the middle eastern cuisine; that would be a great introduction for them. & Since Im very used to the middle eastern cuisine both the labanese and the persian i would give it 6/10.Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom. The Main dishes: Shaorma and mixed grills

aNR0Ej-1vCHtCM2QRqYANQ.text: I had occasion to come to this wonderful restaurant while in London and am from a Lebanese/Syrian background.  I am an American but have had middle eastern food my whole life.  It was literally some of the best I have ever had.  The salads were all so fresh and the grilled meats and cheeses flavored perfectly. The hummus and the grapes leaves and Syrian bread with tabouleh were so well seasoned.  I asked Fatima the proprietor who her chef was.  She told me it was herself!  But she has clearly taught the cooks because she was out front meeting everyone. If you go be sure to order the deserts as well as the Lebanese coffee.  My family loved it and the place was packed. Make reservations or call before you go in.

ojZif9oTM_3A4l2z_zrqkQ.text: Walked in with no reservation at around 7:30 pm but fortunately they were able to accommodate us (party of two). The atmosphere was buzzing and the restaurant was very busy. Service was quite slow to start but the food more than made up for it.We ordered the hummus, chicken wings and halloumi to start and shared a plate of the mixed grill combination which came with three types of meats and side of rice. The hummus was the best I've ever tasted while the chicken wings, halloumi and the meats were all fantastic. Zero complaints but don't anticipate great service as to not be disappointed.

jOP7aIc3t0ERxrLigBEFEA.text: All I can say is wow!!!  Best chicken Swarma and lamb cutlets I've had.  Must try this place if you are in the area

URfNULdPa9pSuv1GtAvIzA.text: This place is great- best Middle Eastern food I have had in years. Service great, food presentation awesome!

LuPl1i4TSdkuAMY-Qh0bQg.text: After a long flight, we just wanted some warm and comforting food. This place exceeded our expectations - we went on a Monday evening. There was no wait and we ordered moujaddara, manakeesh bel zaatar, halloumi, and mousaka. These appetizers were enough to satiate our appetite. The manakeesh was warm and flavorful, the halloumi was grilled perfectly. London has so much good food to offer but I won't hesitate to come back to Orjawan again!

0_4e-QulTYnNzSTvV-MSYg.text: Great food, perfectly prepared. Excellent service... attentive but not pestering and very positive. No pressure to order or to eat but helpful in making selections to make the meal the best it can be. Falafel was the best and grilled meat very delicious. Prices were on par with this part of London. Good selection of Lebanese wines. I will go here next week with my wife for her birthday!

eFYbUoumBMnMx3dqUstMMQ.text: Someone called this the best Lebanese outside of Beirut. Not with this pita!The taste and texture seemed of sweet white flour. I was disappointed. Also, the cheese-filled pasty (hot mezze) was cold in the middle; obviously frozen. Disappointed again.The hummus was tasty, the tabouleh super fresh and delicious, and the chicken skewer was perfect.The service was nice but slow. The bathroom needs renovating.The prices are too high for what it is.

JBbvAuWiyvPsASB-f_UpKA.text: Great Lebanese cuisine. Very fresh and tasty ingredients and good portion size. Service is very nice with great explanation of the dishes and the ambiance is cosy. Their hummus Beiruty is a must try and you can order everything without any doubt.

zbhXfzD0K_C-qWngOGyp9w.text: Haven't written a review in a while but have to give Orjowan five stars, hands down. Best falafel Ive ever had. The lamb shwarma was on point. Service was attentive and excellent. I'll be back and will probably bring any out of town guests here.

KnTdFKcL_ctLK1RHgjl1Cg.text: I've had the lamb shawarma to take-away and the mixed shawarma while dining in. Both were delicious. I also ordered a fresh lemonade while dining in which was on par with the rest of the dish.The food is a bit more expansive than the Middle Eastern take-aways spots in the area, but the food is definitely better.The venue itself is a small, pleasant, and quiet atmosphere with a very friendly staff.

Klcl3pR0j6wPEh2btAGkDQ.text: we had a party of ten people, which they accommodated nicely. Reservations for a party of that size are a must! We had shared appetizers of hummus beiruty, tabouli , and the Lebanese Mountain Salad for starters. They were fresh and tasty!  I should have stopped there, because I wasn't hungry anymore... But we continued. Our group ordered th Mixed Grill, Mixed Shwarma,FARROUJ MESHWI ( boneless baby marinated chicken),ORJOWAN KING PRAWNS. Our lovely hostess Fatima served us some delicious Lebanese Sweets after our meal. A few. In our group loved the hummus and tabouli so much they order to takeaway for the next  day!

ap3cWagG7KGmdFccRVaLug.text: Fantastic! Never had any interest in libanese food - but since visiting Orjowan I'm addicted to Mezze! Incredibly friendly waiter, fresh and delicious bread - I hope to find such a good libanese restaurant in Germany. Hope to come back soon! :):)

B3MgxQYcQAR8J9wSr-EKtQ.text: Delicious, healthy options available, very friendly.I ordered the chicken soup expecting a clear, broth-based soup and was pleasantly surprised by a tart, minty, yogurt-based opaque white soup. Yum!The waiter brought us pastries at the end of the meal and then as we were leaving asked us to wait a minute, as he seemed unable to resist running to get us another handful of sweets "for the walk", wrapped up in a napkin. A sweet gesture indeed!

vD_wtjTSFK13B8EJgKZekg.text: Absolutely amazing Lebanese food. The only downside was how tightly squeezed in we were.

2PYDSOR46ZF0FqmOKJLBCg.text: So much yes. Fresh hummus, mouth watering tabbouleh and the mixed grill was fantastic as well. The sauces that come with the mixed grill are to die for as well- I loved the creamy, white sour cream-type dip. I also order a fresh squeezed orange juice. I can't wait to fly back to London, for the fun and food, which includes this restaurant.

JMe6fpRzIfdriJ5VuWL1lA.text: One word: yum!Had dinner here with friends in January for my last night in London, and we couldn't have asked for a more fantastic time. It was slightly drizzling and there weren't many people (I think we were the only people), and the restaurant has a nice, quiet atmosphere. The waitress was pleasant and helped us choose from the menu, which was definitely needed since there was so much we wanted to order (we did still order way too much in the end...)The spicy potato appetizer was delicious! I got the chicken shawarma which was also fantastic--it was way too much food for me though, the portions are pretty sizable. Though definitely better than paying more for less. I also really like the bread, which was warm and has a really nice texture.I also have to give a thumbs-up to the lamb, which my friend got - I usually extremely dislike mutton, but it doesn't taste like mutton (??) at all. It was delicious and I would now actually consider ordering that dish when/if I go back to London. Definitely a hidden gem and would recommend to anyone visiting nearby!

eKDP_1s_jZUmQeOcBe8ocw.text: Service with a smile--well executed food.  Loved my chicken wings, excellent tabbouleh and great bread.  But most importantly, the wait staff was attentive, friendly, and delivered.  Family kind of place with good food.  This is a gem for Earl's Court.

tZuhDGkflrOpZ5H1Ai6LkA.text: This place is the real deal if you're looking for authentic Lebanese food. The Kafka and lamb sandwich is amazing. The owner is extremely sweet.

smCljS1-6c0eW3xCztqjmw.text: Best chicken shawarma I've ever had. Ingredients are fresh and well-prepared. Hummus is some of the best ever. They have a convenient cafe next to the main restaurant that seems to be open earlier. Staff was "passably friendly". Will definitely be going back here.

t-lw9iH2c_EPD1iW-8dWYA.text: Great Lebanese restaurant.  Nice, classy interior with professional but not stuffy service.Started with a few mezze and the big complaint was did not order more dishes.  The hummus was great, probably the best I have had in London.  Falafel was perfect. My son had the fried calamari and ate it all (much to my chagrin).  Also great flat bread.My main was just as good.  I had the mixed platter, lamb, chicken and shish taouk.  All were cooked perfectly.  I am not much of a rice order but even really enjoyed the rice.Also, excellent selection of Lebanese wine. I ended up ordering two bottles of the wine I tried on Amazon while I was at the restaurant.  An overall excellent experience.

uXr2AVy9_kq-jJL8LoueaA.text: I think the best hummus I've ever had.  The chicken wings are marinated overnight and they were juicy and have a great flavor.  We enjoyed everything we tried.

R3ZxqhLaPbmbRorg5NmLmg.text: This is the best food in London. Every time I am in London I come here. Everyone I tell them about it loves it too. Great food and great staff!! A must try when in London!!

07JrP9WOJHx0u2HpOdbZsw.text: Amazing food! I've been looking for Lebanese food that could match what I had in Saudi Arabia for the better part of the last decade and I have finally found it! Got the mixed grill based on a Yelp recommendation and it was phenomenal! The white sauce that comes with it is amazing! Great place, very close to the Earls Court tube station on the District and Circle Lines if you're trying to find it. I've eaten at most of the little restaurants there and most are good but this one is the best!

B4pMaReK5dMzxgRtWBoORQ.text: Food and service was great. Definitely satified late night cravings. Good cooked fresh to order. Friendly and professional service. Wait line can be a challenge if you are in a hurry, but worth it. Highly recommend.

5tphsp98RXNxJs2zWD1mIA.text: 2nd time I've been here. Every time I had a really good experience. Service is really good and the food is off the charts. Well priced as well. The haloumi is a must. Recommend the moussaka as well.

zi51I7zlytFBx0aFeq6vrQ.text: Could not be happier with dinner at this place... stayed locally in the Area and the food was perfection, the service was fabulous and Tariq the manager was so hospitable and sweet to us. The Labneh is a must and sea bass was fabulous!! Wish we left room for dessert but there is always next time

mK01KB7enN7FxLEou85ZQg.text: Orjowan serves up beautiful Lebanese food at reasonable prices. The falafel here is cooked to perfection -- flavourful and not too dry; chicken shawarma is tender and not overly seasoned; love the minted lemonade -- so refreshing and not too sweet; and finally, the most memorable for me are the chicken wings with garlic sauce. I still dream about this light and creamy sauce that paired perfectly with the moist wings. I'd go back in a heartbeat!

photos.caption: Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom. Amazing falafel, chicken wings with garlic sauce, fresh minted lemonade and chicken shawarma plate.

OX0oPwiNClKMpPKiinJGIg.text: I don't really understand the hype for this place. My husband and I had samboussik cheese, lentil soup, bamieh with rice, and some sort of lamb dish. My husband was happy with his lamb, but I found samboussik way too salty (but I guess one has to make an allowance for the fact that there are three different types of cheese inside the pastries), and the lentil soup and the okra very bland and boring. Maybe we didn't order the right food, but I've definitely had better at other Middle Eastern restaurants for a fraction of the cost. The waitstaff, the ambience, and the waiting time were all fine, though.

v79wTf1YAU3fMuBorwjkGA.text: Very tasty food. Had a group of six and was a bit tight for seating (downstairs) but the staff was very friendly. We tried the kibbie, hummus, and lamb and chicken schwarma and all of them were very good.

o0pHN4dhAsFHqJmqAHGO5w.text: Yum! The food here, is great! Loved the hummus, lamb shawarma, and thin, soft pita. So much on the menu that looks good.

yXZPGAmuG6U93tZ_cSRuVQ.text: Healthy fresh ingredients and service with a smile.  Plus a milk custard-like dessert I really enjoyed... I wish I took a photo.  It had crumbled pistachio on top. This place was a nice surprise for lunch, hidden on a side street.

photos.caption: Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom. Lamb shawarma was fantastic!

A0aMJFJKExFWcKb6bpWK0Q.text: What a gem!  This place is such a fantastic find.  I can't say I've ever had Lebanese before but being vegan I scoped out the menu and thought it was worth a try. When we got there I was a little concerned.  Fancier than I thought it would be and the place was deserted.  Glad that didn't stop is.My wife and I were pretty hungry and decided to just split a bunch of plates.  We got falafel, hummus, a zatar flat bread and spicy potatoes.  Each item was great, but the falafel was incredible.  Best I've ever had.  The staff was also really friendly and helpful.  I'd certainly go back if we find ourselves in London again.

photos.caption: Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom. Compilation of the food

dp3pvaQdlqmJzfHSjzaPnQ.text: If you want amazing food come here! Don't fill up on the hummus appetizer because as delicious as that is, the main courses are even better!

iw1SWUy422w4jtknJXUvcA.text: Anyone who say this place is bad is totally wrong. They basically had to roll us out of there because there was so much food. Service was good and food was great

PN_IfwYYE8H3b_cZn9pMtA.text: I wish I would know how good (or bad) their food is. Unfortunately, this is a small restaurant, and, despite having 10 empty tables for two, they could not sit my party of two (!?!?) even though we had reservations.  We were told that those tables were already reserved!?!? In other words, of you're not a "regular," they will not sit you until another table becomes available (which in our case could have been a half hour). Thus, not a place I would recommend if your not living in Chelsea!

Pz-38O9uTeK0_6P5BNLOXA.text: Always good to see that a Yelp recommendation stands up to the existing reviews.  My friends and I went to the restaurant (there is a take away section as well) - quite convenient near Earls Court station.  We had to wait a bit for one of our friends to arrive - and we never felt rushed to order.  Agree with everyone with how lovely the service is - def service with a friendly smile which is quite rare these days in London.  We definitely ordered a bit too much - 5 mezzes and a main each.  Probably best to order about 3 mezzes and sharing 1 main course because it's huge.  The hummous was fantastic as well as the mutabal.  We also ordered falafel, halloumi and fatayer.  The fatayer was the only one where I thought it was a bit meh.  The mezzes came with this delicious warm flatbread. My friends ordered the chicken and lamb shawarma and they were properly massive. I think we could've shared 1 for the 3 of us.  I ordered the Orjowan prawns which was really good but really heavy on the sauce and very few prawns - worked out great because I was stuffed by then anyhow.  We finished up with coffee and fresh mint tea and it was really nice to get some baclava to accompany it.  I will def be back!

9A0XGae2ycdXo9P_OrwGjg.text: My husband and I ate here on our trip to London in April 2016, and it was fantastic.  We had the hummus with spicy chiles, foul, a lemony bean soup, some tabouleh, and some more things that I can't remember.  Everything was delicious.  The space is tiny, but hey, it's London.  Service was good.  Reasonable prices.  I recommend!

vdZeDwZnK-jqtLdq8tjvKA.text: Great find in the Kensington area.  I'm from São Paulo, so I'm quite familiar with Lebanese cuisine and knew what to order/expect.Very cozy ambience with an upscale feel (think:white tablecloths).  We had the za'tar flatbread, kibie, and shish taouk (chicken kebab) --which came with some Lebanese rice. Very tasty, good price.  Service was a bit scattered due since the restaurant was full.  Communication was also difficult at times due to language barrier.  I'd also recommend skipping dessert.

8ch5pvWqli5sBzS8W1n0kQ.text: This food was so delicious! Service top notch! We were in visiting from California , stumbled into the place. The hummus was to die for and the bread. The wine was perfect, the lamb no words! After the meal we were so full and slept like babies! We even went again the night before we flew out!

IEJY-CUdnAn-Mnhdd84eGw.text: No review can do this place justice. The food was fabulous, service was warm and prompt, and we enjoyed every course, from mezze to dessert! The portions were generous and we (2) shared 2 appetizers, 1 entree, and 1 dessert, with beverages with each. Our waiter recommended the hummus Beiruty, which was very garlicky and included mint, with bread fresh from the oven. The hummous was light and flavorful. We also had lamb samboussik, delicately flavored. We shared an entree (suggested by our waiter), which was still so much food that we took half home. We accompanied the entree with a nice Pinot Noir from the Bekaa Valley. The baklava order was 4 different versions of baklava, and we had Turkish coffee, of course! The restaurant has a warm family atmosphere, which combined with the excellent food, makes for a fantastic experience.

hCQX-adrvylpKLMPSlL37Q.text: Fabulous family run restaurant!  The food is tasty and fresh.  Thank you to the owner and her family for their hospitality.Service  was excellent.Menu has a wide selection of Lebanese items so you won't leave hungry.Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Shawama
Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom. Fresh Hummus

ulSTXUkYV0MRp_Ot4lAUZw.text: Beirut is too far to get great falafel and mutabal? Then just go to this restaurant. It feels like home food from Lebanon or Palestine, and the staff is incredibly nice. Portions are huge. All very fresh. Really thinking I want to make this my second home.

asHFgNhFu3YpWYvZdOp-1Q.text: Heard London had great Lebanese cuisine, found this place through the Yelp app. Location is nicely decorated, white table cloths but a casual feel. Server made some recommendations to share a bunch of mezze and split a grill plate. They really pushed the wine here and seemed to have a good selection.We were directed toward standard choices like hummus, baba, and falafel but, being familiar with the cuisine, chose to try the labneh, sojok (homemade sausages), and arayes (filled with lamb and onion), which were all good. The babaghanouj, mountain salad, and halloumi were also pretty decent but less interesting. The grill plate added onto that (with lamb, shish taouk, and kafta) was just the right amount to share and we left stuffed. Pricing was fair for the amount received. Food was more generally Mediterranean than specifically Lebanese.

photos.caption: Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom. Pricing, service included
Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom. Mixed grill platter
Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom. Stuffed pita

jW9bnZkZWfqre7JjpcC3gg.text: This food makes me happy. My friend Eva brought me here for dinner and enjoyed it. Great tasting food and good value for the amount of food you get. I have found a new place to add to my list of regular restaurant to visit when I'm in London. The manager and the staff were extremely accommodating. The owner even stopped by to chat! Small place, but the food has big flavors!  Super delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom

beEGdZ6ox9o3Drkc9n0jBQ.text: Wanting something different and always having good memories about Lebanese food, we gave this place a try. Attentive service with a smile and a good atmosphere. I had the hot mezze, hummus with lamb and mixed nuts which was good but I've tasted better hummus (had the consistency of mashed potato) Followed by the mixed grill which was great, the lamb and chicken were cooked to perfection and everyone else loved their meal as well. We sat for a while afterwards chatting and laughing and there was no rush to pay the bill and clear out.I am torn between the prices being a bit on the pricey side and being fair, I think the hummus starter was expensive for what it was and the drinks were ranging from £2.50-£3.50 for soft drinks/water and fruit juices. It was a great dinner and would definitely pay them a visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom. The mixed grill with accompanying sauces

G71uJ1PuCY_neYMYSLwu9w.text: THE finest Lebanese food in the U.K. by far.  Staff are exceptional.  My wife and I went twice this week and the staff welcomed us back like we were old friends.  And the dining room was booked solid with people. The veg options are spectacular and the falafel is just so delicious that we could make a meal out of it alone - (well maybe along with their freshly baked pita!)As an example of the professionalism of the staff, at the next table was a rude loud classless American complaining about her fake gluten allergy and why wasn't she told about ingredients, etc.  Well, why not ask, silly woman?  In any event the staff handled her with calmness and grace.  I felt embarrassed about the antics of my countryman. Lastly, make sure you get here.  You will NOT be disappointed! And don't miss their baklava! WOW!

photos.caption: Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom. Dining room
Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom

x8kVdmsMZmObTyd5QfwgvA.text: Great food, super friendly staff.    If I lived on this side of the world, I would definitely be back!

twTye0FRjvUF17TiMnEvNQ.text: Exceptional place! The food is as good as proper tasty home food in Lebanon, the service is the most kind ever, and good value for money. Couldn't expect more

e6h5zzKkKGaM-rcRgDTNqQ.text: Absolutely AMAZING food.  The owner couldn't have been any nicer and more informative.  He was patient with our questions and very detailed in his answers.  He also offered suggestions to our party of 5.  The food was very flavorful and the portion sizes excellent.  There was not one member of my party that wasn't satisfied.  A definite do over !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom

hSyDiVs2bbteerJVbBbxrg.text: We decided to try somewhere different on a Saturday night so decided to walk to Earls Court to for Lebanese food.    The trip was worth It. The place was really packed with people waiting for tables, though we had bookedThere was a great selection of Meze to start with plenty of hot and cold choices.    We really liked to humus and cheese pastries.  The mains were also substantial.   The boneless half chicken and also the lamb shank were great.   To drink we had a couple of bottles of Lebanese wine.

ynHm_qSG6URn70v80qsmbg.text: The line here was crazy long but the food was definitely worth it. I was on vacation with my friends in London so everything seemed expensive but this was one of the places I still remember the food from because it was so delicious.I ordered the fetteh which is a lamb dish covered in warm yogurt, fried onions, pita chips, and pomegranate seeds. Everything about this dish was ridiculously good. My friends ordered assorted kebabs and other foods which they enjoyed but people seemed to like this fetteh most!

photos.caption: Photo of Orjowan Lebanese Cuisine - London, United Kingdom

2IlcX2Jc2kjTUbto3HPKsg.text: Just returned to the U.S  and I'm still dreaming about this place. I've had some pretty good Lebanese food, but I will say that this is the best Lebanese food I have ever had. I wanted to go twice while I was visiting but unfortunately our time in London was limited. Must try the mixed grill. It comes with this garlic sauce that is to die for. So so so good. Best meal we had in London!

M6LfDrvT68sSdYHXGrAfsg.text: Absolutely amazing authentic Lebanese. If you're anywhere close this is the one to visit. We came here repeatedly during our stay in South Kensington. We tried the manakeesh which was out of this world, very unique and also shwarma, mousaka, muhamara and the hummus. Try the orange blossom coffee too!

BP0BaVpNUc8BSO5BUqta4A.text: Visiting from the States, stayed in Kensington and found this place with authentic Lebanese home made food. the appetizers were good including the halloumi  cheese and the Lentil soup. The meat and shawarma were fresh just cut from the rotating grill. The kebab was well seasoned service was great.

235bM8Xa-kGd9RJkl9Ej0g.text: From the US, stumbled in after getting off the Tube at Earl's Court. So glad we did. Easily some of the best hummus I've ever had.

KiOO7mWajoFN0AI6e4V82A.text: Excellent Lebanese cuisine.  The kibbeh and shawarma are particularly good.I've been to Orjawan twice now and I'll be very sorry that there isn't Orjawan home in the states.  The high bar they set on our first visit was remarkable but the second dinner we've had there was even better.The food was fresh and extremely well prepared.  The meats were cooked perfectly, succulent, tender, flavorful and nicely spiced.  The breads were not cold or rewarmed but oven fresh.  The hummus was clearly not just ladelled out of a plastic bin -- ground smooth without any distasteful grittiness.  The sauces were light, tangy and an excellent compliment to the lamb and the kibbi were tender, tasty and so good that they didn't need any embellishment whatsoever.

VNp7u4soNtigkaY8NmkjZQ.text: This was our second visit and it was as good as the first! Delicious, fresh, and great sized portions. The hummus beiruty is sooo good and so was the bread. We loved the shawarma, mixed grill, and lamb skewers. Everything was full of spice and flavor and tasted amazing. Service was great too! Will definitely be back.

-KxklrvyelxVwptKBUD2bg.text: Came here tonight based on yelp reviews. It was close to our hotel. Small place, and attentive service. Everything was delicious. We started with lentil soup that was so flavorful. The croutons were a nice add. We split two warm mezzes: haloumi cheese that was grilled (ohmygod) and spinach and onion pastries. The spicy prawn dish was amazing. We had house wine. Very nice. I hope to return on this trip or the next.

3_UWMyTrmi7leWWp__adbg.text: This place is totally  overrated by reviewers. Tiny smelly place woh terrible service . Food is average Lebanese food , but service is far worse then any other Lebanese place ever been to by any standard . Rude and cranky . Even while sitting us they were rude . The food was just dropped on the table .
